etymologies: French: boubou (sense 1) probably imitative of its call; boubou (sense 2) from Malinke bubu

definitions: an African bush shrike (songbird) with the upper parts mainly blackish in color. It is noted for the duet of bell-like calls produced by the male and female together.

notes.text: Genus Laniarius, family Laniidae: several species, in particular the tropical boubou (L. aethiopicus) and the southern boubou (L. ferrugineus)

definitions: a long, colorful, loose-fitting garment worn by both sexes in parts of Africa.
shortDefinitions: loose-fitting garment worn in parts of Africa
